title: Jesse Harrison
text:
About
I work as the Development Manager of the AI & Data Analytics (AIDA) group at CSC - IT Center for Science. My previous roles at CSC have included working as the Scientific Coordinator of the Horizon Europe BioDT project and as a Senior Data Scientist.
I hold the title of Docent (Associate Professor) in Environmental Sciences at the University of Helsinki. Prior to joining CSC, I worked as a postdoctoral researcher at the Universities of Edinburgh, Vienna, Helsinki and Turku.



Further details

See my resume for more information.
I also have a website for art.

title: PerMedCoE ELIXIR feature
text:
PerMedCoE combines clinical patient data with data related to the operation of genes, proteins and cells. The goal is to develop easy-to-use tools that can be used in precision medicine, leveraging the power of modern supercomputers.


Recently a feature on the Horizon 2020 PerMedCoE project, titled Personalised medicine against cancer and viruses, was published on the ELIXIR Finland website.
The text features commentaries from CSC - IT Center for Science (Project Manager Sampo Sillanpää and myself), as well as the Institute for Molecular Medicine Finland (Group Leader Esa Pitkänen).

R and bioinformatics courses
Courses I have developed and taught at CSC - IT Center for Science Ltd include:

Data Analysis with R (introductory course on data wrangling, plotting and statistics)
Microbial Community Analysis with Chipster (intermediate course on amplicon data analysis)
Puhti R/RStudio Workshop (introductory course on using R on the Puhti supercomputer)

I have also taught R courses at the University of Helsinki (KLTO-132 Statistics with R).

title: Research and technical projects
text:
Current research projects

ELLIOT
European Large Open Multi-Modal Foundation Models For Robust Generalization On Arbitrary Data Streams

Funding: Horizon Europe (€25M)
Period: 2025 - 2029
Coordinator: CERTH


Description
ELLIOT seeks to develop a family of open trustworthy Multimodal Generalist Foundation Models: AI systems designed to learn general knowledge and patterns from massive amounts of data of various types (e.g. videos, images and text to sensor signals, industrial time series and satellite feeds) and efficiently transfer the knowledge gained to different downstream tasks.


Tasks

Local (CSC) PI

BioDT
Biodiversity Digital Twin for Advanced Modelling, Simulation and Prediction Capabilities

Funding: Horizon Europe (€11M)
Period: 2022 - 2025
Coordinator: CSC - IT Center for Science Ltd


Description
BioDT seeks to develop prototype digital twins to push the current boundaries of our understanding of biodiversity dynamics, leveraging the LUMI supercomputer.


Tasks

PerMedCoE
HPC / Exascale Centre of Excellence in Personalised Medicine

Funding: Horizon Europe (€5M)
Period: 2020 - 2023
Coordinator: Barcelona Supercomputing Center


Description
PerMedCoE seeks to improve the usability and compatibility of key personalised medicine modelling tools with next-generation exascale supercomputing systems.


Tasks

Organising Committee Member (2023 PerMedCoE Summer School)

title: Research and technical projects
text:
Environment maintenance & design

r-env
R / RStudio container on Puhti supercomputer

Description
r-env is an Apptainer container including R, RStudio Server and TensorFlow. Many of the 1300+ R packages included offer support for parallel computing (including MPI jobs) and geospatial analyses.


Tasks
2019-2022:

Design, implementation and maintenance on Puhti (Finnish national supercomputing cluster)
Research support (500+ users) and maintaining technical user documentation
R environment design for the CSC Sensitive Data Desktop





Chipster microbiome analysis
Semi-automated tools for microbial community metabarcoding analysis

Description
Chipster is a user-friendly analysis software for next-generation sequencing data, such as scRNA-seq, RNA-seq, ChIP-seq and microbial community metabarcoding data.


Tasks
2019-2021:

Developed a semi-automated toolbox for OTU-based microbial community comparisons

title: Blog post on ML for sensitive data
text:
Real4Reg is a consortium of ten European institutions which aims to promote the use of real-world data to support regulatory decisions about medicines.


A short blog post prepared for the EU-funded Real4Reg project, focusing on machine learning on sensitive data. CSC contributes to topics related to data science, ML, and AI in the Real4Reg consortium, including data analysis tasks using the CSC Sensitive Data Desktop.

title: ELLIOT project launch
text:
The EU-funded ELLIOT project aims to develop the next generation of open, trustworthy, and multi-modal foundation models that can effectively utilize diverse data types.


See here for a blog post on the launch of the Horizon Europe ELLIOT project, published on the CSC website. Examples of CSC contributions to the project include supporting the pretraining of large-scale foundation models using the LUMI supercomputer, participating in improving the core capabilities of the resulting models, and model fine-tuning.
